# Check the arXiv

This simple script lets you automatically check the [arXiv](http://arxiv.org/) for new potentially interesting papers.

You choose the list or lists you want to watch (e.g., `hep-th`) and the keywords you are interested in, and `check_arxiv` looks for relevant papers published that day on the arXiv. It can also optionally download the papers in PDF format for you to review.

## Usage

First, you should modify the `lists` and `keywords` variables of the script to your desired values:

    lists = ["hep-th", "hep-ph"]
    keywords = ["dark energy", "dark matter"]

You can define as many lists or keywords as you see fit. Optionally you can also set the `download_pdfs` variable to `True` to automatically download the PDF files to a location given by `download_dir`:

    download_pdfs = True
    download_dir = "/home/user/Desktop/"

After this, you can just execute the script normally:

    $ ./check_arxiv

You may want to use `cron` or a similar tool to automatically execute the script early in the morning every weekday or find more creative uses.
